note.en:
‚öôÔ∏è The preposition **DE** is one of the most versatile in Spanish. It has many uses.

üîπ **1. ORIGIN / PROVENANCE**
‚û°Ô∏è *Soy de Francia.* (I'm from France.)
‚û°Ô∏è *Vengo de la escuela.* (I'm coming from school.)
‚û°Ô∏è *Es de Madrid.* (He/She is from Madrid.)

üîπ **2. POSSESSION**
‚û°Ô∏è *El libro de Mar√≠a.* (Maria's book.)
‚û°Ô∏è *La casa de mis padres.* (My parents' house.)
‚û°Ô∏è *Es de Juan.* (It's Juan's.)

üîπ **3. MATERIAL**
‚û°Ô∏è *Una mesa de madera.* (A wooden table.)
‚û°Ô∏è *Un anillo de oro.* (A gold ring.)
‚û°Ô∏è *Zapatos de cuero.* (Leather shoes.)

üîπ **4. CONTENTS**
‚û°Ô∏è *Una taza de caf√©.* (A cup of coffee.)
‚û°Ô∏è *Un vaso de agua.* (A glass of water.)
‚û°Ô∏è *Una botella de vino.* (A bottle of wine.)

üîπ **5. TOPIC / SUBJECT (ABOUT)**
‚û°Ô∏è *Un libro de historia.* (A history book.)
‚û°Ô∏è *Hablamos de pol√≠tica.* (We talk about politics.)
‚û°Ô∏è *Clases de espa√±ol.* (Spanish classes.)

üîπ **6. CHARACTERISTIC / DESCRIPTION**
‚û°Ô∏è *El chico de ojos azules.* (The boy with blue eyes.)
‚û°Ô∏è *Una mujer de 30 a√±os.* (A 30-year-old woman.)
‚û°Ô∏è *Un hombre de negocios.* (A businessman.)

üîπ **7. TIME OF DAY**
‚û°Ô∏è *A las 8 de la ma√±ana.* (At 8 in the morning.)
‚û°Ô∏è *A las 3 de la tarde.* (At 3 in the afternoon.)
‚û°Ô∏è *A las 10 de la noche.* (At 10 at night.)

üîπ **8. WITH CERTAIN VERBS**
Many verbs are followed by **DE**:
- *acabar de* ‚Üí to have just (recent past)
  ‚û°Ô∏è *Acabo de llegar.* (I've just arrived.)
- *dejar de* ‚Üí to stop
  ‚û°Ô∏è *Dej√© de fumar.* (I stopped smoking.)
- *tratar de / intentar de* ‚Üí to try to
  ‚û°Ô∏è *Trato de estudiar.* (I try to study.)
- *tener ganas de* ‚Üí to feel like
  ‚û°Ô∏è *Tengo ganas de salir.* (I feel like going out.)

üîπ **9. COMPARISON WITH "THAN"**
Before a number, use **DE** instead of *que*
‚û°Ô∏è *M√°s de 100 personas.* (More than 100 people.)
‚û°Ô∏è *Menos de 5 euros.* (Less than 5 euros.)

üí° **Required contraction:**
**DE + EL = DEL**
‚û°Ô∏è *Vengo del trabajo.* (I'm coming from work.)
‚û°Ô∏è *El libro del profesor.* (The teacher's book.)

‚ö†Ô∏è **Watch out:** No contraction with *√©l* (personal pronoun)!
‚û°Ô∏è *Hablo de √©l.* (I'm talking about him.) ‚ùå *del √©l*

üí¨ **Combined examples:**
‚û°Ô∏è *Es un amigo de la universidad que viene de Italia.* (He's a friend from university who comes from Italy.)
‚û°Ô∏è *Acabo de comprar una taza de t√© de porcelana.* (I just bought a porcelain tea cup.)
